title: Strengthening Curriculum Development Practical Competencies: Applying Instructional Design Models for Digital Educational Material Development

context.prior_knowledge: Proficiency in basic digital tools and comprehension of secondary-level science curriculum
context.additional_context: Competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: Digital educational materials (e.g., interactive e-books) for elementary science can be designed by applying the Rapid Prototyping Model (RPM) or the Dick & Carey Model (DCM)
Critical thinking (analytical skills, self-confidence) and problem-solving abilities (task performance confidence) are evaluated during the instructional design process

Learners choose at least three of the Big Five personality traits (extraversion, conscientiousness, openness, agreeableness, neuroticism), analyze conflict scenarios in digital resource development collaboration, propose two collaboration strategies per trait, and achieve at least 3 out of 4 points in peer evaluation for strategy feasibility.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
